body_html:
I am working in a branch to split some tensorflow in parts in dlls. So far the kernels are registered in a GlobalRegistry which is a multimap. This can go in a dll. If it goes there, then every kernel can be made as a dll and will have own pdb and the problem will disappear. For this to happen. 1. proto files must be in a different dll like tf_proto.dll 2. tf_kernel_registry.dll must be made 3. tf_core_kernels must be split.
…

body_text:
I am working in a branch to split some tensorflow in parts in dlls.

So far the kernels are registered in a GlobalRegistry which is a multimap.
This can go in a dll. If it goes there, then every kernel can be made as a
dll and will have own pdb and the problem will disappear.

For this to happen.

1. proto files must be in a different dll like tf_proto.dll
2. tf_kernel_registry.dll must be made
3. tf_core_kernels must be split.
…

body:
I am working in a branch to split some tensorflow in parts in dlls.

So far the kernels are registered in a GlobalRegistry which is a multimap.
This can go in a dll. If it goes there, then every kernel can be made as a
dll and will have own pdb and the problem will disappear.

For this to happen.

1. proto files must be in a different dll like tf_proto.dll
2. tf_kernel_registry.dll must be made
3. tf_core_kernels must be split.






On Thu, 19 Jul 2018 at 23:19, Vincent Labonté <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @jrs-synth <https://github.com/jrs-synth> You are right my work around
> only works with -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_GPU=OFF...
>
